CHST X-ray ( **DATE[Dec 07 06] ): The cardiomediastinal silhouette is unremarkable .
There is improved aeration at both bases .
There are no effusions .
There is atelectasis / scaring in the right midlung .
Subjective
This is a **AGE[in 70s] y/o male who came to ER with increasing SOB , cough , chest pain .
He was admitted for exacerabation of copd .
He is still SOB but better than yesterday
No CP now .
Last night he had CP &amp ; bad cough .
Nurses told that he had decreased Urine out put &amp ; responded well to two 500 ml boluses .
No fevers .
Physical Examination
General Exam
Vital signs :
As mentioned above
Constitutional :
Dyspneic at rest .
Using asccessory muscles of respiration
Lungs :
Diffuse b/l wheezing +
Inspiratory crackles heard b/l at the bases .
Abdomen : soft , bowel sounds : normal , not rigid , no tenderness .
Neuro :
Mental Status :
AAOX3 .
Motor strength intact .
sensation to touch intact .
Babinski 's - downgoing b/l .
Oropharynx : normal
Heart : normal
Arterial Pulses : normal
Plan
COPD [Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease] ( ICD9 496 , Working , Problem )
Acute exacerabation diffuse wheezing +.
Still Sob .
Cough + on solumedrol 80 mg i.v Q8h .
Will continue it .
Continue advair , spiriva , alb.neb.
Contniue theo er .
Will change avelox iv to po
CAD [Coronary artery disease] ( ICD9 414.0 , Working , Problem )
On aspirin .
Will continue it
Continue lipitor .
BENIGN ESSENTIAL HYPERTENSION ( ICD9 401.1 , Working , Problem )
Stable now .
To hold antihypertensives if SBP&lt ; 100 .
On cardizem  , lisinopril , HCTZ .
CHEST PAIN ( ICD9 786.5 , Working , Problem )
Chest pain - probably musculoskeletal .
Trops- negative .
Disposition
1. Decreased urine out put -
No dysuria , fever .
No lower abdomen discomfort .
?? dehydration .
Responded to iv fluids .
Will continue to monitor I/O s .
2. Steroid induced hyperglycemia
On ISS .
Accuchecks Q6h
